## Reactive Fucntions
Use reactive functions like variables, but call the function name in-place.
```{r eval=FALSE}

value <- reactive({
	input <- input * 2
})

# use like this
new_input_value <- value()
```

Use `return()` similarly to a `break` to return conditional values

```{r eval=FALSE}

value <- reactive({
	if(input&val == TRUE){
		phrase <- "It's true"
		return(phrase)
	}
	phrase <- "It's false"
	
	
})
```
